alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Lincoln (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 1:52AM CST until February 23 at 6:47PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Huntsville AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Tennessee... Elk River above Fayetteville affecting Lincoln and Franklin TN Counties. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Elk River above Fayetteville. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, Bottomland along the river begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 16.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early this morning to a crest of 19.0 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 17.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.4 feet on 12/01/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
